learning_outcomes.description: Distinguish and classify the different principles underlying the design of Database Management Systems (DBMS).
Experiment with DBMS software such as PostGreSQL.
Analyze the fundamental techniques and algorithms applied for data storage, processing, and retrieval.
Design relational databases with considerations of data integrity and system performance.
Examine recent trends and advances in the area of data management systems.

assessments.due_date:
Week 2 Fri - Week 13 Fri

Due on 4 PM Friday of each teaching week starting week 2 and ending week 13.
assessments.category: Creative Production/ Exhibition, Participation/ Student contribution
assessments.task_description: Weekly activities run through RiPPLE platform are designed to test the knowledge and techniques related to Relational Database Management Systems. The assessible tasks will consist of a combination of learning resource creation, moderation and practice. Detailed task specifications will be announced and placed on Blackboard at the required time.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.due_date:
6/09/2024 4:00 pm

Multiple submissions are allowed. The assessment will be based on your last submission.
assessments.task_description:
Assignment 1 aims to implement a number of database techniques using PostgreSQL under a given application setting. It will focus on ensuing database application semantics using various integrity constraints and SQL Triggers.

Assignment details will be provided in the assignment handout released on Blackboard. Students are required to finish this assignment individually.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submission guidelines will be included in the assignment handout.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.due_date:
25/10/2024 4:00 pm

Multiple submissions are allowed. The assessment will be based on your last submission.
assessments.task_description:
Assignment 2 aims to implement a number of database techniques using PostgreSQL under a given application setting. It will focus on improving database efficiency using views, indexes, and query planning.

Assignment 2 details will be provided in the assignment handout released on Blackboard. Students are required to finish this assignment individually.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submission guidelines will be included in the assignment handout.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: All topics introduced in this course will be covered in the final exam.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 13(22 Jul - 27 Oct)
learning_activities.topic:
Lectures

The weekly course lectures will provide in-depth knowledge of various concepts and techniques in the design of Database Management Systems (DBMS). Lecture notes will be available for all the topics covered in this course.


Learning outcomes: L01, L03, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Lectures The weekly course lectures will provide in-depth knowledge of various concepts and techniques in the design of Database Management Systems (DBMS). Lecture notes will be available for all the topics covered in this course.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 13(22 Jul - 27 Oct)
learning_activities.topic:
Take home work (Design and Implementation)

Students will be provided with the instructions for two assignments to work towards the design and implementation of a relational database system using PostGreSQL.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Take home work (Design and Implementation) Students will be provided with the instructions for two assignments to work towards the design and implementation of a relational database system using PostGreSQL.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 2 To Week 13(29 Jul - 27 Oct)
learning_activities.topic:
Practicals

The weekly Practicals will start from Week 2. Practicals will allow students to become familiar with various methods in the implementation and optimization of database management systems.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Practicals The weekly Practicals will start from Week 2. Practicals will allow students to become familiar with various methods in the implementation and optimization of database management systems.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 2 To Week 13(29 Jul - 27 Oct)
learning_activities.topic:
Tutorials

The weekly Tutorials will start from Week 2. Tutorials will provide an opportunity to further understand the concepts introduced in the lectures via examples, exercises and problem-solving.

Learning outcomes: L01, L03, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Tutorials The weekly Tutorials will start from Week 2. Tutorials will provide an opportunity to further understand the concepts introduced in the lectures via examples, exercises and problem-solving.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 2 To Week 13(29 Jul - 27 Oct)
learning_activities.topic:
RiPPLE personalised learning activities (Computer Exercise)

Students will be required to complete four RiPPLE rounds (each with three weeks), which includes generating, reviewing and answering instructor and peer-generated questions. This work forms a progressive assessment task over 12 weeks starting from Week 2, finishing at Week 13.

Learning outcomes: L01, L03, L04, L05
